text:
Examples should almost always save outputs (and sometimes intermediate results), as this is what end-users want to do.

We have to keep in mind that many end-users learn to use Python for neuroimaging why nilearn, so they have no idea how to save things. In addition, they learn by copy-pasting the examples, for the better or the worst.
title: Add more saving of outputs in examples

text: Doesn't it conflict with sphinx behavior?

> Doesn't it conflict with sphinx behavior?

I don't think so, it's just a few
"component_img.savefig('components.nii.gz')"
at the right place in the examples.
Oh, OK, you were talking about the nifti files. I was thinking of the figures.

> Oh, OK, you were talking about the nifti files. I was thinking of the figures.

Indeed niftifiles

> end-users

What's the difference between a user and an end-user?
+1 on more explicit saving to disc. I would also think that a) plotting (for paper) and b) dumping (to further inspect in Mango/Fslview etc.) are the main meta aims of the baseline end-user.
